name: Introduction to Economics
description: This course provides an introduction to the field of economics, covering topics such as supply and demand, markets, economic indicators, and macroeconomic models.

name: Intermediate Microeconomics
description: This course covers more advanced topics in microeconomics, such as consumer choice and producer behavior, market equilibrium, and the theory of the firm.

name: Intermediate Macroeconomics
description: This course covers more advanced topics in macroeconomics, such as the determination of national income, fiscal and monetary policy, economic growth, and international economics.

name: History of Economic Thought
description: This course introduces students to the history of economic thought, covering the development of economic ideas from the ancient world to the present day.

name: Economic History
description: This course focuses on the economic history of a particular region, such as Europe, Asia, or the United States, and covers topics such as industrialization, urbanization, and the Great Depression.
